page.title: 09Halls
page.content: Swardeston Hall (GR208024) Known locally as Gowthorpe Manor, the earliest part dates from 1574. It is built of red brick, with rose,mary and pantiled roof, and has thirty rooms. It is owned by the Steward family. Dunston Hall (GR225021) Built in 1859 and replacing a previous hall much damaged in the Civil War, it was the home of the Long family. The estate was sold in l957 and since then the hall has had varied uses. Stoke Holy Cross Hall (GR243007) This Elizabethan mansion was demolished in 1935 after tragedies in the Birkbeck family who owned it. Swainsthorpe Hall There is not one. The Long family used to own all Swainsthorpe so Dunston Hall was looked upon as its Hall.
